intro: Spermacoce mauritiana, commonly known as the African moonflower, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its striking white, night-blooming flowers. The plant produces small, round, red berries that contain the seeds. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or shrubland habitats. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens in warm climates.
